meanings.definition: To put (a liquid) back into a bottle.
meanings.sent1: After the spill, she had to rebottle the juice carefully.
meanings.sent2: I need to rebottle the water to keep it fresh.
meanings.sent3: He tried to rebottle the soda, but it fizzed everywhere!
meanings.sent4: She had to rebottle her emotions before speaking.
meanings.sent5: The task was to rebottle the magic potion without spilling a drop.

meanings.definition: To put (a liquid) into a new bottle.
meanings.sent1: Let's rebottle the homemade jam for gifting.
meanings.sent2: I will rebottle the perfume into a smaller container.
meanings.sent3: He decided to rebottle the wine in a fancy bottle.
meanings.sent4: She had to rebottle the essence of the potion for safekeeping.
meanings.sent5: The plan was to rebottle the potion under the moonlight for extra magic.
